definition[0]: the 12 month period used by governments to calculate spending and how much tax a person or business must pay
definition[1]: the 12 month period over which a company calculates its profits or losses
example[0]: For the first nine months of its fiscal year, the company’s after-tax profit rose 21% to $364 million.
definition[3]: the 12-month period used by government departments for calculating BUDGETs etc, in Britain ending on April 5
example[1]: The cabinet gave its approval for an austere budget for the next fiscal year.
example[2]: Emergency medical care cost the city $66.5 million in fiscal year 1998.
